column4: does anyone know if the install cd's shipped from "shipit" on ubuntus website has configuration for a bootloader?
or does it wipe the hard drive
did you read the verify howto uboto linked to you?
md5 checksums are an integral part of *nix
they are on the same page you d/l the iso from
ah, you should be able to run "md5sum /dev/cdrom0" or whatever your cdrom device is
it may be cdrom0 or cdrom1 or seomthing
or your cdrom drive is crap
check your md5 on the .iso image you downloaded
you can use kde apps under gnome and vice versa
both DMs are "open" to your interpretation
